intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pannonicum subsp. parreyssianum, commonly known as the Pannonian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in some regions and is of interest in botanical conservation studies.
